item.title: Preprocessing data for data science (Part 1)
item.description: A recent study showed that 60% of the time spent by data scientists consists only on cleaning and organizing data. So in order to make the most out of our time, my data science fellas, in this four-part series we’ll se how to preprocess data like a boss, using the Pandas Python library and the preprocessing module from scikit-learn. Pretty much everything we do in an AI algorithm are matrix operations.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi! My name is Luis Carlos Contreras (aka Chuik) and I’m a software engineer. I created this blog to share some of my experiences with programming. I have six years of experience in software development, four of them as a web developer and two as an artificial intelligence engineer. Throughout the years, I’ve learnt a bunch of programming languages and technologies including: Python (for back-end and machine learning) Linux (server management) Swift and Java (for mobile app development) JavaScript (for hating my life working on front-end) Data Science (because statistics is too mainstream) Useful links about me:
